tn.text: "To separate yourself to someone" means to "dedicate yourself" to that person. AT: "dedicates himself ... he dedicates himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This idiom means that he must not eat or drink them. AT: "he must not consume" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "vinegar that people make from wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
a drink produced when wine and other strong drinks fermented too long and became sour
You can make clear the understood information. AT: "or vinegar that people make from strong drink" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"dried grapes"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "he separates himself to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: nothing that is made from grapes
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "nothing that people make from grapes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: from the seeds to their skins
tn.text: These two extremes are given to emphasize the entire grape may not be eaten. AT: "from any part of a grape" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
This is an idiom. Here "separation" means "dedication" AT: "vow of dedication" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: no razor is to be used on his head
tn.text: This can be stated in active form.   AT: "no one is to use a razor on his head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the days of his separation to Yahweh
tn.text: The word "separation" is an abstract noun that can be expressed as a verb. Here "separation" is an idiom that means "dedication." AT: "the days that he has separated himself to Yahweh" or "the days that he has dedicated himself to  Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "to Yahweh are complete" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: He must be set apart to Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "He must set himself apart to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "separation" means "dedication." AT: "dedicates ... dedicated ... dedication" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
A person who is not acceptable for God's purposes is spoken of as if the person were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "he has separated himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The abstract noun "separation" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "that he has separated himself"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "he has reserved himself for Yahweh" or "set apart for Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Here "head" represents the Nazirite man's hair, which symbolizes his vow. AT: "defiles his long hair which shows everyone he is separated to God" or "he becomes defiled" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: on the day of his purification
tn.text: The abstract noun "purification" can be stated as the verbal phrase. AT: "on the day when he makes himself acceptable to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"the 7th day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"the 8th day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: for the days of his consecration
tn.text: "during the time he is being set apart again"

tn.ref: He must bring a male lamb ... as a guilt offering
tn.text: The man is to bring the lamb to the priest so that it can be sacrificed. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "He must bring a male lamb one year old to the priest as a guilt offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: The days before he defiled himself must not be counted
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "He must not count the days before he defiled himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "he defiled himself" or "he made himself unacceptable" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Here "separation" means "dedication." Also, this abstract noun can be expressed as a verb. AT: "of his dedication" or "that he has dedicated himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] or [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "Someone must bring him" or "He must go" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: He must present his offering to Yahweh
tn.text: He must bring his offering to the priest to be sacrificed to Yahweh. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "He must present his offering to Yahweh by bringing it to the priest to be sacrificed" or "He must present his offering to Yahweh by bringing it to the priest who will sacrifice it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "bread he made without yeast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "fine flour that he mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: wafers without yeast rubbed with oil
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "wafers without yeast which he rubbed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
small pieces of flat bread

tn.ref: together with their grain offering and drink offerings
tn.text: The word "their" refers to the other offerings that the Nazirite man was told to bring. Often grain offerings and drink offerings were required to accompany other types of sacrifices. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "together with the grain offering and drink offering that Yahweh required to accompany the other offerings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: He must offer his sin offering
tn.text: "He" refers to the priest and "his" refers to the man who took a vow.
"as the fellowship offering"

tn.ref: The priest must present also ... drink offering
tn.text: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "The priest must present also ... the drink offering to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

Here "separation" means "dedication." Also, this abstract noun may be written as a verb. AT: "indicating his dedication" or "indicating how he has separated himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: the boiled shoulder of the ram
tn.text: This means that he had boiled the ram's shoulder. This can be stated in active form. AT: "the shoulder of the ram that he boiled" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Here "separation" means "dedication." Also, this abstract noun can be expressed with the verb "separated." AT: "indicating dedication" or "indicating that he has dedicated himself to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

After handing the items to the Nazirite, the priest takes them back to offer them to Yahweh. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "Then the priest must take them back and wave them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"as well as"
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "that the priest waved" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that he presented" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

- Here "separation" means "dedication." Also, this abstract noun may be written as a verb. AT: "his dedication" or "for having dedicated himself to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This refers to the Nazirite deciding to give other offering beyond what he has been commanded to give. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "If he decides to give any additional offerings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: he must keep the obligations of the vow he has taken
tn.text: "he must still obey the requirements of the vow he has taken"

tn.ref: he must keep the obligations ... to keep the promise indicated by the law for the Nazirite
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are combined to emphasize that he must obey the obligations of his vow. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: the promise indicated by the law for the Nazirite
tn.text: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "the promise that the law for the Nazirite indicates" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You must bless the people of Israel
tn.text: "You" is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: May Yahweh bless you and keep you
tn.text: Here "you" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is an idiom. Here "keep" means to "protect." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: make his face shine on you
tn.text: This is an idiom which means to have kind intentions towards someone. It can also be expressed by smiling. AT: "smile at you" (UDB) or "look at you with kindness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here the phrase "look on" means to show a certain attitude towards that person. AT: "show you favor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: May Yahweh make his face shine on you ... and give you peace
tn.text: Here "you" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

Here Yahweh speaks about claiming the Israelites as his own by saying that he is giving them "his name."  AT: "they must let the people of Israel know that they are mine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
